articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military told Palestinians to temporarily evacuate southern neighborhoods of Gaza's Khan Younis region so it could "forcefully operate" there, telling them to relocate to a humanitarian area in Al-Mawasi, a statement from the military said on Saturday.
articles.title: Israel tells Gazans to temporarily vacate southern Khan Younis areas

articles.author: Drazen Jorgic
articles.description: As a propeller plane on Thursday whirred towards the U.S.-Mexico border to cross illegally, U.S. agents raced to meet it at a small municipal airport near El Paso, Texas, and arrest two men who were part of Mexican drug trafficking royalty.
articles.title: How El Chapo's son helped U.S. arrest fabled narco chief "El Mayo"

articles.author: Amy Tennery, Richa Naidu, Karolos Grohmann
articles.description: Pouring rain in Paris on Saturday forced the men's Olympics street skateboarding competition to be postponed and tennis matches were also delayed, while athletes had mixed feelings about how to cope with the unexpectedly wet weather.
articles.title: Pouring rain disrupts Games after drenched opening ceremony

articles.author: Nelson Acosta
articles.description: Havana residents watched from shore on Saturday as Russian warships arrived for the second time in as many months, in a visit that Cuba called routine.
articles.title: Russian warships make routine visit to Cuba

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 27,000 people in northeast China were evacuated and hundreds of factories were ordered to suspend production as Typhoon Gaemi brought heavy rains, the official Xinhua news agency reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi forces evacuation, factory suspension in northeast China

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Vietnam on Saturday to pay his respects following the death of Communist Party chief Nguyen Phu Trong, underlining warmer ties between the countries a half-century since they fought a brutal war.
articles.title: Blinken pays respects in Vietnam after death of Communist Party leader

articles.author: Helen Coster, Alexandra Ulmer, David Morgan
articles.description: Donald Trump called her "crazy," "nuts" and "dumb as a rock." Republicans in Congress disparage her as a diversity hire. Right-wing activists and trolls smear her online with racist, sexist and sexualized barbs.
articles.title: As racist and sexist attacks fly, Republicans grapple with how to take on Harris

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nine people were killed in a rocket attack on a football ground in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights on Saturday, Israeli Channel 13 reported, amid an escalation of fire between Israel and armed groups in Lebanon.
articles.title: Nine people killed as rocket hits football pitch in Israeli-occupied Golan, Israel media report

articles.author: Martin Petty
articles.description: Australia's foreign minister urged Myanmar's military rulers on Saturday to take a different path and end an intensifying civil war, as top diplomats of world powers gathered in Laos ahead of two summits seeking to tackle key global issues.
articles.title: Australia's Wong presses Myanmar generals to change tack ahead of Laos summits

articles.author: Valentini Anagnostopoulou
articles.description: Armed with selfie sticks and phones, the tourists flood into Santorini from everywhere - on dinghies from giant ocean liners, on coaches that zigzag up the steep hillsides, atop donkeys that clip-clop along the narrow cobbled streets.
articles.title: Greece's Santorini bursts with tourists as locals call for a cap
